alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rutland and northwestern Windsor Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Woodstock, Killington, Shrewsbury, Rutland City, Stockbridge, Proctor, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Plymouth, Bridgewater, Mendon, Clarendon, West Rutland, Ira, Pittsfield, Reading, Middletown Springs, Chittenden, Castleton, and Poultney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
